title: Three Hostage-Takers Killed In Paris Area
teaser: We get the latest as two hostage sieges in Paris come to an end. The suspects in the Charlie Hebdo massacre have reportedly been killed.
contentencoded:
Authorities in France have brought an end to a pair of hostage standoffs — killing three gunmen, including the two brothers suspected in this week’s deadly attack on the offices of a satirical newspaper in Paris.

Police say the two brothers came out of their hideaway with guns blazing, and were killed in a clash with security forces. Their hostage was freed safely. A short time later, another hostage-taker in Paris was killed, along with three of the hostages he had held at a kosher grocery.

Here & Now’s Robin Young and Lisa Mullins get the latest on the developing situation in Paris from Bloomberg correspondent Gregory Viscusi in Paris, the BBC’s Rob Watson and Jytte Klausen of Brandeis University.

Guests

  • Gregory Viscusi, Paris correspondent for Bloomberg News. He tweets @gviscusi.
  • Rob Watson, BBC political correspondent. HeÂ tweets @robwatsonbbc.
  • Jytte Klausen, professor of international cooperation and politics at Brandeis University and author of “The Cartoons That Shook the World.”
